contentrichtext.text: {{refimprove|date=May 2012}} {{Infobox UK place |country = England |official_name= Ripponden |latitude= 53.672 |longitude= -1.946 |population = 6,412 |population_ref = ''(2001)'' |civil_parish= Ripponden |metropolitan_borough= [[Calderdale]] |metropolitan_county = [[West Yorkshire]] |region= Yorkshire and the Humber |constituency_westminster= [[Calder Valley (UK Parliament constituency)|Calder Valley]] |post_town= SOWERBY BRIDGE |postcode_district= HX6 |postcode_area = HX |dial_code= 01422 |os_grid_reference= SE035195 |london_distance= |static_image=[[Image:Ripponden St Bart.JPG|240px]] |static_image_caption=St Bartholomew's Church, Ripponden }} '''Ripponden''' is a village and [[civil parishes in England|civil parish]] within the [[Calderdale|Metropolitan Borough of Calderdale]], in [[West Yorkshire]], England, near [[Halifax, West Yorkshire|Halifax]], on the [[River Ryburn]]. [[Historic counties of England|Historically]] part of the [[West Riding of Yorkshire]], it is the site of a Roman settlement, and there is a [[Roman Road]] over nearby [[Blackstone Edge]], a rocky ridge of [[Millstone Grit]]. It has a population of 6,412.<ref>[http://www.neighbourhood.statistics.gov.uk/dissemination/viewFullDataset.do?instanceSelection=03070&productId=779&$ph=60_61&datasetInstanceId=3070&startColumn=1&numberOfColumns=8&containerAreaId=790270 Office for National Statistics : ''Census 2001 : Parish Headcounts : Calderdale''] Retrieved 2009-09-02</ref> Ripponden is the main settlement in a small group of villages; [[Barkisland]], Ripponden, [[Rishworth]] and [[Soyland]]. The citizens of Ripponden are represented on Ripponden Parish Council. The area is a substantial part of the Ryburn Ward, itself part of [[Calderdale]] metropolitan borough. Ripponden and its villages were formerly served by the [[Rishworth Branch|Rishworth branch line]] from [[Sowerby Bridge]]; [[Ripponden and Barkisland railway station]] closed to passengers in 1929 and the line was closed completely in 1958. The area is of archaeological note for the Roman road at Blackstone Edge alone and is also rich in [[neolithic]] and [[bronze age]] remains. At nearby Ringstone Edge can be found a small [[stone circle]] and neolithic settlement. Upon Rishworth Moor, an [[Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty]] and home to many rare animals, can be found the [[Cat Stones]], a series of ancient round barrow burial sites. [[File:The Beehive Inn, Ripponden (26th September 2010).jpg|thumb|left|The Beehive Inn]] Ripponden is the terminus of the annual [[Sowerby Bridge]] [[Rushbearing]] Festival. ==Notable people== York City Football Club player [[Clarke Carlisle]] lives in Ripponden with his wife and their two children.{{citation needed|date=May 2012}} Nobel Prize winning physicist Prof [[Richard Feynman]] was a regular visitor to the village in the 1960-1980s, with his wife who was born locally.
